🎿 **Bozeman Skiing Guide (Excluding Big Sky)**

### 🏔️ Bridger Bowl Ski Area
- **Distance**: 16 miles northeast of downtown Bozeman
- **Website**: [bridgerbowl.com](https://www.bridgerbowl.com)
- **Style**: Nonprofit, community-owned ski hill
- **Vibe**: Affordable lift tickets, friendly local crowd, steeps and powder in the "Ridge" area (expert-only)
- **Terrain**: Beginner to expert, including hike-to terrain for advanced skiers
- **Tickets**: Day passes ~$70–90, cheaper than Big Sky
- **Rentals & Lessons**: Available on site
- **Shuttle**: Daily winter shuttle from downtown Bozeman (limited seating; check schedule on website)

### ⛷️ Cross-Country Skiing Around Bozeman
- **Highland Glen Nature Preserve**: Groomed trails next to the hospital – beginner-friendly
- **Sourdough Canyon (Bozeman Creek)**: Classic local favorite for skiers of all ages
- **Crosscut Mountain Sports Center** (near Bridger Bowl): World-class Nordic skiing with rentals and trails for all levels
- **Hyalite Canyon**: Backcountry trails, some groomed; no rentals on site
- **Lindley Park** (in town): Groomed loops for classic and skate skiing

### 🏔️ Other Ski Options Within Driving Distance
- **Showdown Montana**
  - **Location**: Near White Sulphur Springs (~2 hrs north of Bozeman)
  - **Website**: [showdownmontana.com](https://www.showdownmontana.com)
  - **Local Tip**: Affordable family skiing with a fun retro vibe

- **Discovery Ski Area**
  - **Location**: Near Phillipsburg & Anaconda (~2.5 hrs west of Bozeman)
  - **Website**: [skidiscovery.com](https://www.skidiscovery.com)
  - **Style**: Diverse terrain – groomers, steeps, and trees
  - **Great for**: Those looking for an alternative weekend trip

---

### 🧭 Local Notes
- Bridger Bowl is locally beloved for keeping skiing accessible.
- Crosscut is ideal for Nordic skiers and only 1 mile from Bridger Bowl.
- Hyalite is great for snowshoeing and Nordic skiing if you're up for adventure.
- Rentals available at **Bangtail**, **Round House**, and **Nordic Company** in Bozeman.



---

### ❄️ Cross-Country Ski Trail Summary
- **Crosscut Mountain Sports Center**: Over 35 km of groomed trails; rentals available
- **Sourdough Canyon (Bozeman Creek)**: Classic long trail (~10 miles out-and-back), good for all levels
- **Highland Glen Nature Preserve**: Easy access in-town; beginner-friendly loops
- **Hyalite Canyon**: Multiple backcountry-style trails; some groomed, no rentals available on-site
- **Lindley Park**: Groomed loops in the heart of Bozeman (free and accessible)

---

### 🛷 Snowmobile Rentals & Trail Systems

#### Rentals:
- **Summit All Terrain Rentals** (Bozeman)
  - Phone: (406) 581-5086
  - Website: [summitallterrainrentals.com](https://www.summitallterrainrentals.com)
- **Big Boys Toys Rentals**
  - Location: North Bozeman
  - Phone: (406) 587-4747
  - Website: [bigboystoysrentals.com](https://www.bigboystoysrentals.com)
- **Rockin’ TJ Ranch**: Guided sledding tours available (call ahead for reservations)

#### Trail Areas:
- **Gallatin National Forest**: Dozens of marked trails—popular zones include Taylor Fork, Buck Ridge (near Big Sky), and Olson Creek
- **Hyalite Canyon**: Limited snowmobiling allowed; always check closures
- **Brackett Creek & Olson Creek**: North of Bozeman; scenic groomed paths

---

### 🎿 Ski & Gear Delivery Services
- **Black Tie Ski Rentals of Bozeman**: Ski delivery direct to hotel, Airbnb, or lodge
  - Website: [blacktieskis.com](https://www.blacktieskis.com/bozeman)
  - Phone: (406) 414-1850
- **Door 2 Door Ski Rental Delivery** (available through some resorts and Airbnb hosts)
- **Round House** & **Schnee’s**: Offer gear pickup and potential custom drop-off by request

✅ Local Tip: Delivery services are best for early morning arrivals or group/family setups. Schedule ahead during peak season (Dec–Mar).
